item.title: Modifying Firmware for Fun and Profit
item.description: Something about me: I find it pretty annoying when my devices tell me what I must do. A phone that demands an update within 48 hours feels less like a tool and more like a landlord. From my high school days, I owned a calculator. It was obvious that since it was my calculator I could use it how I pleased. Somehow companies have made us think differently about phones, gaming consoles, and cars.

item.title: Dev Tooling & Leadership @ Rivian|VW
item.description:
Role: Software Integration Engineer
Company: Rivian & Rivian and Volkswagen Group Technologies
Location: Vancouver, BC

Overview

Owned the release execution for v2.21 while scaling automated UI and API coverage across Android and iOS. The goal was to keep the release cadence predictable, reduce manual testing, and keep QA aligned with product and engineering.

What I shipped

  • Led a sub-team of four through the full release cycle with PM, design, and dev.
  • Built PyTest + Appium automation in GitHub Actions for simulated and bench vehicles.
  • Expanded Android and iOS coverage and isolated regressions early.
  • Mentored junior interns on test design, debugging, and automation fundamentals.

Impact

  • Improved release confidence by increasing automated coverage across platforms.
  • Reduced coordination overhead by keeping release status and blockers visible.

Stack

Python, PyTest, Appium, GitHub Actions, Android Studio (Java/Kotlin), Xcode (Swift)

item.title: Test automation & CI/CD integration @ Operto
item.description:
Role: Quality Assurance Engineer
Location: Vancouver, BC
Team: Operto Guest Technologies

Overview

Focused on building a reliable E2E suite that matched the most common user flows so feature releases could ship faster without manual regression cycles.

What I shipped

  • Authored 200 Playwright tests in TypeScript covering new features and 85% of top user flows.
  • Integrated the suite into CI/CD to provide fast feedback for engineers.
  • Led cross-team triage to align on severity and ownership.

Impact

  • Significantly reduced manual testing load and shortened release feedback loops.
  • Clearer bug ownership improved release predictability.

Stack

TypeScript, Playwright, CI/CD, FullStory

item.title: Firmware Analysis & QA Tooling @ Gatekeeper
item.description:
Role: Software Systems Engineer
Location: Abbotsford, BC
Team: Gatekeeper Systems Inc.

Overview

Built tooling to eliminate manual testing bottlenecks while also hardening the QA workflow with firmware analysis and anomaly detection.

What I shipped

  • Automated 150 manual tests by emulating HTTPS device traffic using scapy.
  • Reconstructed firmware images with binwalk and analyzed behavior with radare2 and Ghidra.
  • Prototyped user-space emulation with QEMU to validate findings.
  • Delivered a concurrent network/log anomaly tool now standard in the QA toolkit.

Impact

  • Removed the dependency on physical hardware for core regression tests.
  • Improved visibility into device behavior and potential security issues.

Stack

Python, scapy, Wireshark, tcpdump, binwalk, radare2, Ghidra, QEMU
